title: [Epidemiology] Diagnoses of common conditions decreased substantially between March and May 2020, suggesting a large number of patients have undiagnosed conditions. A rebound could be imminent as COVID-19 restrictions ease and patients with undiagnosed conditions or delayed diagnosis present.

[Health] Children treated for multi-system inflammatory syndrome (MIS-C) with SARS-CoV2 (COVID-19) found to have cardiac dysfunction, coronary abnormalities, valvulitis and pericardial effusion, according to records in the U.S., the U.K., Spain and Pakistan. Early cardiology evaluation and follow-up needed.
